alert.note: Alert for Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Page; Rockingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 7:02PM EST until January 06 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of one- tenth to one-quarter of an inch. * WHERE...Rockingham and Page Counties, and the Northern Virginia Blue Ridge. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation is expected to begin as snow between 4 and 7 AM. The snow will mix with and likely change to sleet and freezing rain between 11 AM and 2 PM before ending during the early evening. The snow may be briefly be heavy during the late morning to early afternoon hours.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Page; Rockingham
